  • Built-In Functions

Built-In Functions¶

Compiler built-in functions are used to invoke certain processor operations without writing assembly code. In embARC BSP, a series of built-in functions are provided for both the MetaWare and GNU toolchains.

API Reference¶

group ARC_HAL_BUILTIN

Built-in and helper functions to access ARC hardware layer.

cache related helper function

arc_read_uncached_32(void *ptr)¶

Read memory and bypass the cache.

Return

data in the memory

Parameters

  • ptr: Memory address

arc_write_uncached_32(void *ptr, uint32_t data)¶

Write memory and bypass the cache.

Parameters

  • ptr: memory address

  • data: value to be written

arc_read_cached_32(void *ptr)¶

Read memory with cache.

Return

data in the memory

Parameters

  • ptr: Memory address

void arc_write_cached_32(void *ptr, uint32_t data)¶

Read memory with cache.

Parameters

  • ptr: Memory address

  • data: Data to be written

int32_t arc_goto_main(int32_t argc, char **argv)¶

Go to main function with proper arguments.

Parameters

  • argc: Argument count

  • argv: Argument content array

Return Value

  • Return: value of main function

uint32_t arc_find_msb(uint32_t val)¶

Find most significant bit set in a 32-bit word.

This routine finds the first bit set starting from the most significant bit in the argument passed in and returns the index of that bit. Bits are numbered starting at 1 from the least significant bit. A return value of zero indicates that the value passed is zero.

Return

Most significant bit set, 0 if val is 0

uint32_t arc_find_lsb(uint32_t val)¶

Find least significant bit set in a 32-bit word.

This routine finds the first bit set starting from the least significant bit in the argument passed in and returns the index of that bit. Bits are numbered starting at 1 from the least significant bit. A return value of zero indicates that the value passed is zero.

Return

Least significant bit set, 0 if val is 0

uint32_t arc_core_id(void)¶

Read core id.

Return

Core id

void arc_stack_check_enable(void)¶

Enable hardware stack checking.

void arc_stack_check_disable(void)¶

Disable hardware stack checking.

void arc_kernel_stack_check_configure(uint32_t top, uint32_t base)¶

Configure stack checking in kernel mode.

Parameters

  • top: Top of stack

  • base: Base of stack

uint32_t arc_is_user_mode(void)¶

Check whether processor is in user mode this function relies on AUX_STATUS_BIT_US set in privileged mode first.

Return

1 user mode, 0 privileged mode

void arc_goto_usermode(void *target, uint32_t *sp)¶

Go to user mode It’s suggested to disable interrupt before call this function especially when using current stack, i.e., sp == 0. Because interrupt handling requires kernel mode stack which is different with user mode stack.

Parameters

  • target: Target address to run in user mode, 0 means next line of code

  • sp: Stack where the target address runs, 0 means using current stack

void arc_goto_kernelmode(void *target, uint32_t *sp)¶

Go to kernel mode this function uses trap exception to do switch from user mode to kernel mode, please install exc_entry_arc_goto_kernelmode for trap exception before call this function.

Parameters

  • target: Target address to run in kernel mode, 0 means next line of code

  • sp: Stack where the target address runs, 0 means using current stack

void exc_entry_arc_goto_kernelmode(void)¶

Trap exception entry used for arc_goto_kernelmode.

install this entry for trap exception before call arc_goto_kernelmode

Defines

arc_compiler_usually(a)¶

arc_compiler_usually(expr) evaluates expression expr and informs the compiler that the value is usually true.

arc_compiler_rarely(a)¶

arc_compiler_rarely(expr) evaluates expression expr and informs the compiler that the value is rarely true.

Functions

void arc_mb(void)¶

Do memory barrier.

void arc_rmb(void)¶

Read memory barrier.

void arc_wmb(void)¶

Write memory barrier.

uint32_t arc_aux_read(uint32_t aux)¶

Read auxiliary register.

Return

value of auxiliary register

Parameters

  • aux: auxiliary register address

void arc_aux_write(uint32_t aux, uint32_t val)¶

Write auxiliary register.

Parameters

  • aux: auxiliary register address

  • val: Value to write

void arc_brk(void)¶

Call brk instruction stop the core through a brk instruction.

void arc_sync(void)¶

Call sync instruction.

void arc_kflag(uint32_t flag)¶

Call kflag instruction to change status32.

Parameters

  • flag: Flag to set in status32

void arc_nop(void)¶

Call nop_s function flush the pipeline by nop_s instruction.

uint32_t arc_clri(void)¶

Call clri instruction call a clri instruction to disable interrupt.

Return

interrupt related bits in status32

void arc_seti(uint32_t key)¶

Call seti instruction call a set instruction to change interrupt status.

Parameters

  • key: interrupt status

uint32_t arc_swap32(uint32_t val)¶

Swap bytes order of a 32-bits value.

Return

Swapped value

Parameters

  • val: Target value

uint16_t arc_swap16(uint32_t val)¶

Swap bytes order of a 32-bits value and return high 16-bits.

Return

High 16 bits of the swapped value

Parameters

  • val: Target value
